title: Homemade Caramel Syrup
directions: In a saucepan, combine sugar and water over medium heat.
Stir until the sugar dissolves, then let it come to a boil without stirring.
Allow the mixture to boil until it turns a deep amber color. Keep a close eye to avoid burning.
Remove the saucepan from heat and slowly pour in the heavy cream while stirring continuously. Be cautious as it may bubble up.
If desired, add vanilla extract for extra flavor and stir until smooth.
Let the caramel syrup cool before transferring it to a jar or container.
notes: Great for use in lattes, macchiatos, and other specialty drinks or desserts. Be very careful when adding cream as the hot sugar will bubble vigorously. Store in a sealed jar.
